snippet: In a report, many financial professionals said they knew of wrongdoing in the workplace. And even more found regulators ineffective in stopping it.
abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin DealBook column cites University of Notre Dame survey of 1,200 financial services professionals that finds one-third witnessed or knew of illegal workplace activity; notes almost half said authorities and regulators are ineffective in halting it; states all big Wall Street firms have pledged to be ethical and put bad behavior behind them.
lead_paragraph: In a report, many financial professionals said they knew of wrongdoing in the workplace. And even more found regulators ineffective in stopping it.

headline.print_headline: Many on Wall Street Say It Remains Untamed
headline.main: Many on Wall Street Say It Remains Untamed

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
